intro: Rudgea obtusa, commonly known as the broadleaf rudgea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, followed by elliptical, red-brown fruits. Rudgea obtusa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
